title: Token renewal button breaks "example projects curl"
description: **Describe the bug** A clear and concise description of what the bug is. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to local UI 2. Click on Account and Settings 3. Scroll down to 'Example fetch projects data:' 4. Click "refresh" on the token 5. Copy and paste example fetch curl into terminal **Expected behavior** Should get the projects, instead get error because the curl is incorrectly formatted **Screenshots** the closing quote comes after `Token` instead of after the actual token **Environment (please complete the following information):** - OS: [e.g. iOS] MacOS - Label Studio Version [e.g. 0.8.0] `1.6.0` **Additional context** The error only happens after refreshing the token https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22605641/193113632-f010771f-5fd9-4c60-b58e-6f17bc7abf52.mov

title: Support URL signing when Image tag is an array of URIs
description: **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** When an array of URIs are passed as a task's Image property, URL-signing does not work. This is true both with and without use of the Repeater Tag in the XML config. Example task json:  { "data": { "image": [ "gs://bucket/image_scale_1.jpg", "gs://bucket/image_scale_2.jpg", "gs://bucket/image_scale_3.jpg", "gs://bucket/image_scale_4.jpg", ], "thumb": "gs://bucket/thumbnail.jpg" } }  Here is the error:  [2023-01-11 21:25:03,030] [io_storages.base_models::resolve_uri::85] [INFO] Can't resolve URI=["gs://bucket/image_scale_1.jpg", "gs://bucket/image_scale_2.jpg", "gs://bucket/image_scale_3.jpg","gs://bucket/image_scale_4.jpg"] Traceback (most recent call last): File "/label-studio/label_studio/io_storages/base_models.py", line 83, in resolve_uri return uri.replace(extracted_uri, http_url) AttributeError: 'list' object has no attribute 'replace' [2023-01-11 21:25:03,031] [io_storages.utils::get_uri_via_regex::25] [WARNING] Can't parse task.data to match URI. Reason: Match is not found.  This issue has been documented and discussed in detail in slack [here](https://label-studio.slack.com/archives/CQ8LYPPJS/p1673542950503319). **Describe the solution you'd like** As the [Repeater Tag documentation](https://labelstud.io/tags/repeater.html#Example) suggests, an array of URIs should be a valid value for a task's Image property and work with the URL-signing feature in the backend. Repeater should iterate through each of the values and create signed URLs, which is the case when a single value is passed, with the assumption that the individual elements meet whatever validation checks that are already required. **Describe alternatives you've considered** The desired behavior exists already - it's just about enabling it for all elements in an array, so I can't imagine an alternative. **Additional context** I'm willing to work on the solution to this issue. CC: @AbubakarSaad

Please describe.** When an array of URIs are passed as a task's Image property, URL-signing does not work. This is true both with and without use of the Repeater Tag in the XML config. Example task json:  { "data": { "image": [ "gs://bucket/image_scale_1.jpg", "gs://bucket/image_scale_2.jpg", "gs://bucket/image_scale_3.jpg", "gs://bucket/image_scale_4.jpg", ], "thumb": "gs://bucket/thumbnail.jpg" } }  Here is the error:  [2023-01-11 21:25:03,030] [io_storages.base_models::resolve_uri::85] [INFO] Can't resolve URI=["gs://bucket/image_scale_1.jpg", "gs://bucket/image_scale_2.jpg", "gs://bucket/image_scale_3.jpg","gs://bucket/image_scale_4.jpg"] Traceback (most recent call last): File "/label-studio/label_studio/io_storages/base_models.py", line 83, in resolve_uri return uri.replace(extracted_uri, http_url) AttributeError: 'list' object has no attribute 'replace' [2023-01-11 21:25:03,031] [io_storages.utils::get_uri_via_regex::25] [WARNING] Can't parse task.data to match URI. Reason: Match is not found.  This issue has been documented and discussed in detail in slack [here](https://label-studio.slack.com/archives/CQ8LYPPJS/p1673542950503319). **Describe the solution you'd like** As the [Repeater Tag documentation](https://labelstud.io/tags/repeater.html#Example) suggests, an array of URIs should be a valid value for a task's Image property and work with the URL-signing feature in the backend. Repeater should iterate through each of the values and create signed URLs, which is the case when a single value is passed, with the assumption that the individual elements meet whatever validation checks that are already required. **Describe alternatives you've considered** The desired behavior exists already - it's just about enabling it for all elements in an array, so I can't imagine an alternative. **Additional context** I'm willing to work on the solution to this issue. title: Incorrect display projects per page after selecting a number greater than 30
description: **Describe the bug** If we have more than 30 projects and we choose in the tool to display more than 30 projects per page, only 30 are displayed. However, the number of pages will decrease and some projects will not be displayed. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: Add more than 100 projects Choose 50 or 100 projects per page in projects list view Count the number of projects (quantity is wrong) Change to next page (you can see that the sum of the number of projects is less than 100) **Expected behavior** The page should display the same number of projects as selected per page. The number of projects on all pages should be the same as the number of all projects. **Screenshots** n/a -- can provide if really needed **Environment** OS: Mint Label Studio Version Release 1.7.1 **Additional context** In this line `page_size` should be passed as parameter. https://github.com/heartexlabs/label-studio/blob/9308125b3633997d2546a26a7855804c850cc32a/label_studio/frontend/src/pages/Projects/Projects.js#L70 I found the error together with @mikbuch
